snippet: The leader of the Republican majority said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposal to decriminalize the open possession of small amounts would not pass in its current form.
abstract: Sen Dean G Skelos, Republican majority leader in the New York State Senate, says he is not satisfied with Gov Andrew M Cuomo's proposal to decriminalize the open possession of small amounts of marijuana and will not pass bill in its current form; Skelos says proposal is overly broad and would effectively condone practice of carrying around marijuana.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the Republican majority said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposal to decriminalize the open possession of small amounts would not pass in its current form.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Senators in New York Oppose Cuomo’s Marijuana Plan
headline.main: G.O.P. Senators Oppose Cuomo’s Marijuana Plan
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Leader Says Senate Won’t Pass Marijuana Plan Without Changes
